intro: Pelargonium novum, commonly known as the New Geranium, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces vibrant blooms in shades of red, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Pelargonium novum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant.
